sentences: Richard I (8 September 1157 – 6 April 1199) was King of England from 1189 until his death in 1199.
Richard I (8 September 1157 – 6 April 1199) was King of England from 1189 until his death in 1199.
Richard was born on 8 September 1157, probably at Beaumont Palace, in Oxford, England, son of King Henry II of England and Eleanor of Aquitaine.

sentences: Richard I (8 September 1157 – 6 April 1199) was King of England from 1189 until his death in 1199.
Following his accession, he spent very little time, perhaps as little as six months, in England.

Although he was born in Oxford and brought up in England up to his eighth year, it is not known to what extent he used or understood English; he was an educated man who composed poetry and wrote in Limousin (lenga d'òc) and also in French.
